channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Loose/sunken drain cover on mini roundabout exit by booker, 11th January
item.description:
The drain cover at the mini roundabout exit outside booker is loose and looks sunken.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wymans Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pothole on the edge of the road, westbound, 11th January
item.description:
Pothole located on the edge of the road enough that cars need to go around it, this is on the westbound side (heading towards Swindon village). Narrow but long and looks deep
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hyde Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole in the middle of the road, 11th January
item.description:
Opposite the petrol station. In the middle of the road but more on the side heading towards the traffic light junction. Huge in size, looks deep. Drove through it during the rain as couldn’t see it and it’s a miracle it didn’t damage my car
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broad pothole just past the entrance to the Texaco garage., 11th January
item.description:
It's been this bad for several weeks. People swerve to try to avoid it in their cars, which is dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Albert Road chicanes, 11th January
item.description:
On both chicanes on Albert Road there are extremely large potholes. Dangerous for cyclists on narrowing stretch and pedestrians crossing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 108, Albert Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 10 very large Traffic cones and 2 street closed signs dumped, 11th January
item.description:
I don't know if I am wasting my time reporting this for the second time as no action has been taken to remove these objects fly tipped by your highway contractors. If we can fine individuals for fly tipping then set an example your selves. These items have been on site since the 10km charity run last October!!!!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Park, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Curb loose rocking on corner, 11th January
item.description:
The kerb on the corner of Winchester Way and Salisbury Avenue is loose and rocks. This looks to have previously been repaired. As I have witnessed in several instances, this damaged is being caused by the Stagecoach double decker buses that are too big and often the rear wheel when turning left into Winchester Way regularly mounts the curb/pavement at this particular point.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Winchester Way, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing lights faulty, 11th January
item.description:
Lights kept going off on the push button on the pedestrian crossing meaning it took multiple attempts to get the green man to cross the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 2 potholes, 1 very large, increasing in size as on bus route, 11th January
item.description:
Springbank Road carriageway, outside 68, L.H.S. of bollards (heading North) 2 potholes now
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 79, Springbank Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rattling manhole cover getting worse, 11th January
item.description:
This is supplementary to a previous report. A manhole cover in the junction of North Street and Greet Road is rattling loudly whenever a vehicle crosses it. It has got worse, the whole frame moves if you stand on it and the road surface around it recently started to break up. This is a busy junction and the noise is incessant.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Back Lane, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: THERE ARE A NUMBER OF POTHOLES ON REDGROVE ROAD WHICH NEED ATTENION, 11th January
item.description:
Outside nrs 6, 10, 12, 22
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Dormer Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole on railway bridge, 11th January
item.description:
URGENT Deep pothole on railway bridge approaching from Churchdown side to readings. Hard to avoid without moving into middle of bridge which is dangerous as can’t see oncoming traffic
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole on side of road, 11th January
item.description:
Turn left out of Churchdown the pothole is on the right hand side of road before you reach the house on the left. Getting bigger. Been there for a long time
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous broken up road, 11th January
item.description:
You cannot see this at all when it is dark and due to parked cars opposite have no choice but to drive through it. Lots of cyclists go along here and will easily be taken off their bike by this. This road is continually being patched up. Years of poor repairs have left it in an appalling state. It needs to be completely re-surfaced. Treating roads like a patchwork quilt is not an acceptable approach to ensure public safety.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 40, Whittington Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights with no permit, 11th January
item.description:
Temporary traffic lights in place with no evidence of a permit. These are causing significant delays throughout the Swindon village and Kingsditch area. When will the new installed traffic lights be used and when will Gloucestershire highways show proof a permit on their roadworks website?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manor Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
